newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE white sugar support level under pressure.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE white sugar support level under pressure.

text.p: A recent strong area of support for LIFFE white sugar futures came under heavy pressure on Monday, possibly signalling further losses.

Traders said that $320, basis near August, had been a persistent support level recently and despite a build-up of trade selling it looked like holding again with a little help from firmness in New York.
But another burst of selling, including some from the funds later in the day sent August back down again to last trade at the day's low of $318.60 a tonne.
A close well below $320 could prompt further liquidation orders on Tuesday with $315 seen as the next support area, traders said.
At the close prices were $2.60 to $0.50 a tonne down and turnover totalled 3,058 lots.
In Paris near August came under pressure and closed $1.30 a tonne down and turnover was 595 lots. The 100 ICUMSA contract was $3.0 to $2.50 down and turnover was 170 lots.
